'''Jun S. Liu''' ({{zh|s=刘军|p=Liú Jūn}}; born 1965) is an award-winning [[Chinese-American]] [[statistician]] focusing on Bayesian statistical inference and computational biology. He received the [[COPSS Presidents' Award]] in 2002.<ref>"Committee of Presidents of Statistical Societies: Presidents' Award: Past Award Recipients," National Institute of Statistical Sciences, accessed June 5, 2011, [http://nisla05.niss.org/copss/PastAwardsPresidents.pdf http://nisla05.niss.org/copss/PastAwardsPresidents.pdf].</ref> Liu is a professor in the Department of [[Statistics]] at [[Harvard University]] and has written many research papers and a book <ref>Liu, Jun S. Monte Carlo Strategies in Scientific Computing. New York: Springer, 2001. ISBN 978-0-387-95230-7</ref> about [[Markov chain Monte Carlo]] algorithms, including their applications in [[biology]]. He is also co-author of the Tmod software for [[Sequence motif|motif]] discovery.

Liu was an [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics|IMS]] Medallion Lecturer in 2002 and a [[Bernoulli Society for Mathematical Statistics and Probability|Bernoulli]] Lecturer in 2004. He was elected a fellow of the [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]] in 2004<ref>"IMS Fellows," Institute of Mathematical Statistics, accessed June 5, 2011, [http://www.imstat.org/awards/honored_fellows.htm http://www.imstat.org/awards/honored_fellows.htm].</ref> and of the [[American Statistical Association]] in 2005.<ref>"ASA Fellows," American Statistical Association, accessed June 5, 2011, [http://www.amstat.org/careers/fellowslist.cfm http://www.amstat.org/careers/fellowslist.cfm].</ref>

Liu received his B.Sc. from [[Peking University]] in 1985.   He has a Ph.D. in math from Rutgers University in 1988, and a Ph.D. in statistics under the supervision of [[Wing Hung Wong]] from the [[University of Chicago]] in 1991.<ref>"Home Page for Jun Liu," Faculty of Arts and Sciences, Harvard University, accessed May 29, 2011, [http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/~junliu/ http://www.people.fas.harvard.edu/~junliu/].</ref>
